Description: Marl clay pottery vase with pie-crust wavy handles on shoulder, scraped diagonally to trim on lower body.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Kom el-Ahmar, Fort Cemetery Grave 81 (Hierakonpolis)
Curator's comments: Like Wavy Handled ware W47a in in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. Grave 81 in the Fort Cemetery was excavated by John Garstang and is published in B. Adams, The Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis (1987), p. 83.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Frederick George Hilton Price
